label: 文殿
本: Court and Bakufu in Japan:  Essays in Kamakura History . Stanford University Press . 1982
説明文: During the late Heian period, a documents office or secretariat within the retired emperor's chancellery (in-no-chō). In Kamakura times, a judicial bureau that could issue advisory judgments on the basis of documentary evidence rather than on the evidence of open hearings; subordinate to the in-no-hyōjōshū.　[院庁、院評定衆]
